chapter.title: Install or Update oXygen
chapter.para: To install or update oXygen Author or Editor, you use a JAva Web Start (JAWS) application, which enables you to start application software for the Java Platform directly from the Internet by using a web browser.
When you run JAWS for the first time, it downloads the entire oXygen package, author.jnlp. This package contains multiple JAR files. The download takes a few minutes on a reasonably fast connection.

procedure.title: To download oXygen Author or Editor

step.para: On the web start page, click one of the following links:

listitem.para: Run <oXygen/> Author: Use to edit RackBook (DocBook) documents and WADL files.
Run <oXygen/> Editor: Use to edit RackBook documents and WADL files. Also includes XSD and XSLT-related features.

step.para: On the Opening author.jnlp dialog box, accept the default selection, Java Web Start (default). Then, click OK.
On the Security Warning dialog box, click I accept the risk and I want to run this application. Then, click Run.
After oXygen launches for the first time, you must supply an oXygen Author or Editor license. If you do not have one, request one from a member of the Doc Tools team or your manager.

To use oXygen, click the coffee cup icon on your Dock.

chapter.para: After you close oXygen, you can access it from your Applications folder, or use JAWS to download and update oXygen.
When you launch JAWS again to upgrade oXygen, it downloads any modified jar files only. If no new jars are found or network connectivity is unavailable, oXygen Author or Editor starts immediately.

note.para: If you install oXygen Author or Editor through JAWS and add oXygen plugins to that installation, those plugins are removed when you use JAWS to update oXygen.
